faq.title: Have questions about working with us?

items.question: How long does the selection process take?
items.answer: The complete process usually takes between 2-3 weeks from receiving your application to the final offer. We strive to maintain fluid communication at each stage.

items.question: What documents do I need to apply?
items.answer: You need to send your updated CV. If you have certifications (CPA, CIA, CISA), please include them to enrich your application.

items.question: Do you offer remote or hybrid work?
items.answer: Yes, we offer flexibility in the work modality. Depending on the engagement and client needs, you can work remotely, hybrid or on-site.

items.question: What is the work environment like at Audit?
items.answer: We promote a collaborative and professional environment where we value technical excellence, teamwork and continuous development.

items.question: What professional growth opportunities do you offer?
items.answer: We have personalized career plans, support for professional certifications, and real opportunities for internal promotion.

items.question: Do you offer training programs?
items.answer: Yes, we invest in continuous training with access to courses, certifications, and specialized workshops in audit methodologies and technologies.

items.question: What are the working hours?
items.answer: We offer flexible schedules. During busy season, there may be additional hours, but we compensate with time off during slower periods.

items.question: Is there a probation period?
items.answer: Yes, according to Spanish legislation we apply a probation period. During this time, we mutually evaluate if there is a good professional fit.

items.question: Can I apply if I have no audit experience?
items.answer: Yes, we consider junior candidates with potential. We value attitude, analytical skills, and willingness to learn.

items.question: How do I stay informed about new opportunities?
items.answer: You can regularly check our open positions section or send us your spontaneous application.

faq.title: We Answer Your Questions
faq.subtitle: The most common questions about grant auditing

obligatorio.question: When is an auditor's report mandatory for a grant?
obligatorio.answer: It's mandatory when the call explicitly requires it, when the amount exceeds certain thresholds (generally ‚Ç¨60,000 for expenses and/or ‚Ç¨150,000 in grants), or when the granting body determines so. Additionally, for PRTR funds it's almost always mandatory.

simplificada.question: What's the difference between simplified and audited justification accounts?
simplificada.answer: Simplified accounts only require a declaration and invoices, while audited accounts include a review report by a ROAC-registered auditor who verifies expense eligibility and compliance with the rules.

prtrIncumplimiento.question: What happens if I don't correctly justify a PRTR grant?
prtrIncumplimiento.answer: Non-compliance with PRTR justification may result in full grant reimbursement plus late interest. It could also mean exclusion from future calls and, in serious cases, additional liabilities.

dnsh.question: What is the DNSH principle and how does it affect my grant?
dnsh.answer: DNSH (Do No Significant Harm) means investments funded with European funds cannot cause significant environmental damage. It's mandatory for PRTR and non-compliance is grounds for full reimbursement.

coste.question: How much does a grant audit cost?
coste.answer: The cost depends on project complexity, grant amount and documentation to review. Generally ranges from ‚Ç¨1,500 to ‚Ç¨8,000. We offer no-obligation quotes tailored to each case.

documentacion.question: What documentation do I need to prepare?
documentacion.answer: You'll need: grant resolution, approved budget, invoices and payment receipts, supplier contracts, bank statements, DACI declarations, and project technical documentation as per the call.

tiempo.question: How long does a grant audit take?
tiempo.answer: Depends on documentation volume, but usually 2 to 4 weeks from receiving all documentation. It's important to plan ahead regarding justification deadlines.

irregularidades.question: What happens if the body detects irregularities?
irregularidades.answer: If there are irregularities, the body may request additional documentation, apply partial financial corrections or, in serious cases, demand full reimbursement. A prior audit helps detect and correct issues before submission.
